If you want to cast either spell at a higher level, you must expend a spell slot as normal.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: You can use your action to briefly control elemental forces within 30 feet of you, causing one of the following effects of your choice:

items: Create a harmless, instantaneous sensory effect related to air, earth, fire, or water, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, a spray of light mist, or a gentle rumbling of stone.
Instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
Chill or warm up to 1 pound of nonliving material for up to 1 hour.
You cast the {@spell Control Flames|COOMS}, {@spell Gust|COOMS}, {@spell Mold Earth|COOMS}, or {@spell Shape Water|COOMS} cantrip

optionalfeature.name: Replicate Magic Item
entries: Using this infusion, you replicate a particular magic item. You can learn this infusion multiple times; each time you do so, choose a magic item that you can make with it, picking from the Replicable Items tables below. A table's title tells you the level you must be in the class to choose an item from the table. Alternatively, you can choose the magic item from among the {@filter common magic items|items|source=|type=!potion;!scroll|rarity=common|miscellaneous=Magic} in the game, not including potions or scrolls.

In the tables, an item's entry tells you whether the item requires attunement. See the item's description in the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information about it, including the type of object required for its making.

optionalfeature.name: Projected Weapon
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a weapon attack, and it gains the ability to project itself outwards in order to harm your foes. Different weapons have different projections, and thus can be used a different amount of times per long rest. Consult the table below to determine what projection the weapon being infused can cast:

entries.caption: Projections
rows: Bagh Nakh, Dagger, Jambiya, Kama, Karambit, Katar, Kunai, Sickle, Small Knife, Spiked Knuckles, Chakram, Kukri, Mambele, Tanto, Tessen
Canesword, Katana, Longsword,  Shortsword, Wakizashi, War Fan
Cutlass, Double-Bladed Scimitar, Falchion, Khopesh, Kusarigama, Sabre, Scimitar
Handaxe, Pickaxe, Battleaxe, Double Axe, Greataxe, Urgosh, War Pick
Bo Staff, Javelin, Pitchfork, Quarterstaff, Spear, Yklwa, Dual-Pronged Spear, Gythka, Trident
Blackjack, Brass Knuckles, Cane, Club, Crowbar, Mace, Shovel, Tongs, Wrench, Dire Flail, Greatmace, Morningstar
Claw Hammer, Greatclub, Light Hammer, Sledgehammer, Hooked Hammer, Maul, Warhammer

optionalfeature.name: Bayonet

item: A dagger and either a firearm or crossbow

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a melee, ranged, or spell attack, and it has a dagger affixed to the weapon to allow it a melee attack when necessary without making the weapon unwieldy.
You may use this affixed dagger to make a melee weapon attack with the dagger as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Lantern Hook
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a hook by which to hang a lantern
You may affix a lamp, lantern, or other hung lighting apparatus from the hook in order to equip it with the weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Sawed-Off
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a shorter than average barrel
The weapon becomes light as its weight is halved by removing the barrel, but also can only shoot out to half its range.

optionalfeature.name: Sling
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a sling affixed to it that wraps over your shoulder.
When using this sling, you may equip and de-equip this weapon for free once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Grip
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a modified grip, allowing for better stability while firing.
While using this grip, you are able to reroll a critical failure you make with a spell or ranged weapon attack provided it is made by the infused weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Monopod
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a retractable stand that folds out from the front.
While using the firearm, you can brace without expending movement by extending the monopod as a free action.

optionalfeature.name: Multi-Shot
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has some complex apparatus in order to allow the device to fire more than once.
Firearms with this infusion are able to be loaded with a number of uses equal to your proficiency bonus.

Crossbows with this infusion can substitute an attack action to shoot a number of shots at a single target equal to your proficiency bonus, but need to be reloaded with a one minute reload before they are able to do this again.

optionalfeature.name: Hair-Trigger
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a quick-activating trigger.
You are able to fire this weapon as a bonus action thanks to the trusty trigger.

optionalfeature.name: Scope
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a magical periscope affixed to the weapon to act as a guiding sight.
When looking down the scope, the weapon's normal range becomes its max range.

optionalfeature.name: Suppressed
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a warded barrel that absorbs most of the sound and the flash of light when shot.
When you shoot this firearm, it is as audible as a loud clap.

optionalfeature.name: Gonneshield

item: A firearm and a medium or heavy shield

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a shield integrated into its front without it becoming overbearing.
While using this gonne, you gain a +1 to your AC alongside any additional benefits the shield would normally provide.

optionalfeature.name: Gonnesword

item: A flintlock-firearm and a non-heavy melee weapon

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a melee, ranged, or spell attack, and it is a combination of the two weapons into a firearm melee weapon.
You may use the integrated melee weapon to attack as it normally would along with being able to fire from the gonne. It is the best of both worlds.

optionalfeature.name: Jezzail
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a longer than average barrel.
The weapon's weight doubles, and the weapon shoots at disadvantage due to its unwieldiness, but the weapon rolls twice the number of damage die it normally would.

optionalfeature.name: Projected Trajectory
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a crystal that projects a red beam of light that displays the normal trajectory the projectile would follow.
You make ranged weapon attacks with this weapon at advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Exploding Shot
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has a mechanism that allows its ammunition to explode on impact.

After firing the weapon, whether you hit or miss, all enemies within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take the damage of the firearm, with half as much on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Silenced

item: An arquebus, flintlock firearm, or crossbow

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged or spell attack, and it has an illusion emitter affixed to it that prevents it from making a sound.
When you shoot this firearm, it is completely inaudible.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Blade
entries: You can use your action to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee weapon takes each time you create it (see chapter 5 for weapon options). You are proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: You learn the {@spell find familiar} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature cherub}, {@creature gazer}, {@creature imp}, {@creature oozling}, {@creature pseudodragon}, {@creature mephit}, {@creature quasit}, or {@creature sprite}.
Additionally, when you take the {@action Attack} action, you can forgo one of your own attacks to allow your familiar to use its reaction to make one attack of its own.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Talisman
entries: Your patron gives you an amulet, a talisman that can aid the wearer when the need is great. When the wearer fails an ability check, they can add a {@dice d4} to the roll, potentially turning the roll into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

If you lose the talisman, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous amulet. The talisman turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three {@filter cantrips|spells|level=0} from any class's spell list. The cantrips do not need to be from the same spell list. While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don't count against your number of cantrips known. Any cantrip you cast with this feature is considered a warlock cantrip for you. If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.
Wizards may copy spells and cantrips from your Book of Shadows as if it were a spellbook

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of Shade
entries: Your eyes have been magically touched by darkness, allowing your pupils to creepily expand and contract much more than it normally would. You are immune to the {@condition Photosensitive} condition, meaning Sunlight Sensitivity no longer affects you. Additionally, gain 120 feet of {@sense Darkvision}, which is added onto any existing {@sense Darkvision} you had (if any).

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Runekeeper
entries: You can read all writing, including writing that would normally require {@spell comprehend languages} or {@spell read magic|COOMS} to understand.

optionalfeature.name: Bloodlust
entries: You can cast {@spell Brutality|COOMS} on yourself once per long rest using a warlock spell slot, without expending material components. When casted in this way, the spell is no longer concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Unsealed Power
entries: You can cast {@spell Volatility|COOMS} on yourself once per long rest using a warlock spell slot, without expending material components. When casted in this way, the spell is no longer concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Mariner
entries: As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a medium or heavy shield, you have a swimming speed and a climbing speed equal to your normal speed.

optionalfeature.name: Double Weapon Fighting
entries: When you attack with a weapon using the Double property, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|level=0|class=druid (THICC)}. They count as ranger spells for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the druid spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Strike
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one superiority die. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Evasive Footwork
entries: When you move, you can expend one superiority die, rolling the die and adding the number rolled to your AC until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to reduce the damage by the number you roll on your superiority die + your Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Intense Training
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}), a Strength ({@skill Athletics}), or a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check, you can expend one superiority die and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Obscure Knowledge
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}), an Intelligence ({@skill Nature}), or an Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) check, you can expend one superiority die and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Survival Instincts
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}), a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}), or a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check, you can expend one superiority die and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Underhanded Tactics
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}), a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}), or a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check, you can expend one superiority die and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Sadistic Enjoyment
entries: When you score a critical hit, you can expend one superiority die to gain temporary hit points equal to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Voodoo Doll

item: A body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like alongside a sewn doll

entries: A voodoo doll is made in the likeness of a given person whose piece of body was used in the creation of the doll.
Allows for voodoo or curses at range and makes voodoo saves at disadvantage
Pain done to voodoo doll is done to target, but no damage is done
If doll is torn open or limb removed, target stunned in pain and then voodoo doll breaks

optionalfeature.name: Poppet
entries: Lil Fella follows you around

optionalfeature.name: Cursed Weapon
entries: Turns anything into a weapon when filled with hatred, weapon becomes magical, deals damage die whose faces are equal to two times your proficiency bonus (equal to your malediction die), can be light, neutral, heavy, or two-handed depending on weight and size, could also deal necrotic or force

optionalfeature.name: Bound Weapon
entries: Weapon turns into tattoo on forearm, forcibly attunes, can will weapon onto person for free

optionalfeature.name: Sentient Weapon

item: Any weapon, armor, or shield, and a Soul Gem

entries: Can make a weapon sentient with soul in gem

optionalfeature.name: Cauldron
entries: Raises DC of crafting (or requires more ingredients) but outputs 2-3x shit made

optionalfeature.name: Flying Broom
entries: Weee hee hee

optionalfeature.name: Revealing Lantern
entries: Acts as truesight for everything within range, to any onlookers, thus sees through magical darkness

optionalfeature.name: Soulswapping Mirror
entries: Swap consciousness in mirror with person reflected in mirror, when created, consciousness in mirror has X personality traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws as dictated by you, then when you gaze into it must make a save or have soul swapped into body, can only see person trapped in mirror when looking into it

optionalfeature.name: Entrapping Painting
entries: Luigi Mansion painting, holds body of one person, painting needs to be big enough to hold body, person needs to be incapacitated, painting forms to be related to their life/personality, they can still talk from painting and look from painting, stops aging while in painting, freed if painting is destroyed

optionalfeature.name: Tome of Fate
entries: Spellbook turns into tome of fate, can use it to gain information X times per day

optionalfeature.name: Bell of Commanding
entries: Have control over a person whose voodoo doll you have and force them to do as you ask when you ring bell, needs voodoo doll to work

optionalfeature.name: Cross Brace of Puppeting
entries: Have control over a person whose voodoo doll you have and force them to act the way you move their doll, needs voodoo doll to work, save to Cha, save makes them resist affects for 1 hour

optionalfeature.name: Pin of Harming
entries: Harm a person whose voodoo doll you have by stabbing pin into doll to deal damage, also allows you to deal damage by other things done to doll, needs voodoo doll to work.

optionalfeature.name: Goblet of Insanity
entries: Splash blood on one creature to make them save versus insanity, refills with blood during short rest, must sacrifice HP or 1 CR from Wicked Harvest, can be used a number of times equal to WIS Mod before being refilled

optionalfeature.name: Soul Sorting Hat
entries: States where you will most likely be going when you die

optionalfeature.name: Shrunken Head

item: A creature's head that was killed within the last day and 5 feet of string

entries: Early version of soul gem, requires head of target

optionalfeature.name: Soul Gem
entries: Soul gem off of forgotten realms wiki, also Todd Howard, can be used as a pseudophylactry for undead, can be used to recharge magic items, cant be used to enchant though
A soul gem is used to contain the soul of a creature, the strength of which is determined during the creation of the soul gem, as shown in the following table:

As one can see, the tier of soul gem is based on the price of the gemstone used to create it, with each tier being able to store the soul of a creature whose CR is equal to or less than the described Max Held CR column for a given tier.

optionalfeature.name: Horcrux
entries: Requires soul gem, can be used to store your soul like a phylactry, but can only have one, and does not stop aging or death from old age

optionalfeature.name: Ritual Dagger
entries: Dagger that can be used in Wicked Harvest for additional CR equal to your Wis Mod

optionalfeature.name: Black Orb
entries: Glows with shadows when using Witch Siphon, adds WIS Mod to damage of it

optionalfeature.name: Coffer of Dreams
entries: Once the box is opened and is set next to a sleeping creature, wispy blue clouds of stars pour out of the creature's face into the box. After an hour, if the box is shut, the creature is no longer able to dream, is immune to magical sleep, and does not gain the benefits of a long rest until their dreams are returned to them. The creature does not, however, suffer the effects of sleep deprivation. After a tenday, the creature gains 1 tier of exhaustion that cannot be removed until they take a long rest. If the box is re-opened, the dreams find their way to their owner if they are on the same plane of existence. If not, the dreams stay in the box.

optionalfeature.name: Bound by Fate
entries: Stops aging, can only be killed by a heroic or just death, but once killed, soul is obliterated as its prevented from entering afterlife

optionalfeature.name: Unsuccessful Business
entries: Business becomes shit

optionalfeature.name: Repulsive Form
entries: Disgusting Look

optionalfeature.name: Red Thumb
entries: Nothing can grow from them, opposite of green thumb

optionalfeature.name: Back Pain
entries: Horrible crippling back pain

optionalfeature.name: Sores
entries: Sores all over body

optionalfeature.name: Infertility
entries: Inability to reproduce or get it up in bed

optionalfeature.name: Miscarriage
entries: Sad times for Janmin :(

optionalfeature.name: Lethargy
entries: Lack of will to do something

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Strength
entries: Lose Strength

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Dexterity
entries: Lose Dexterity

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Constitution
entries: Lose Constitution

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Intelligence
entries: Lose Intelligence

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Wisdom
entries: Lose Wisdom

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Charisma
entries: Lose Charisma

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Skills
entries: Penalty to (Any Skill), Something More

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Vengeance
entries: Cursed to have corpse animate when dead and seek out killer

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Selfish Memory
entries: Cursed to have all of your memories of events before 7 days turn into your idealized version of what happened

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Amnesia
entries: Memories gone from point of curse

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Dementia
entries: Mind progresses until completely insane

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Alignment Change
entries: Every long rest save versus spell save DC, on failure move towards alignment of choice every day until desired alignment

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Regret
entries: Shoulders weigh as you are filled with a general sense of regret

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Insanity
entries: Curse goes through madnesses, or just simply indefinite madness

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Medusa
entries: Medusa curse

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Greater Medusa
entries: Greature Medusa (sometimes called Gorgons) curse

optionalfeature.name: Curse of Maedar
entries: Mandark

subclassFeatures: Path of the Totem Warrior|Barbarian|THICC|Totem Warrior|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Path of the Ancestral Guardian|Barbarian|THICC|Ancestral Guardian|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Path of the Storm Herald|Barbarian|THICC|Storm Herald|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Path of the Eldritch Lord|Barbarian|THICC|Eldritch Lord|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Way of the Four Elements|Monk|THICC|Four Elements|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Way of the Open Hand|Monk|THICC|Open Hand|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Way of the Long Death|Monk|THICC|Long Death|THICC|3
Touch of the Long Death|Monk|THICC|Long Death|THICC|17

subclass.name: Way of the Drunken Master
subclassFeatures: Way of the Drunken Master|Monk|THICC|Drunken Master|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Way of the Sun Soul|Monk|THICC|Sun Soul|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Way of the Astral Self|Monk|THICC|Astral Self|THICC|3
Visage of the Astral Self|Monk|THICC|Astral Self|THICC|6
Body of the Astral Self|Monk|THICC|Astral Self|THICC|11

subclass.name: Way of the Ascendant Dragon
subclassFeatures: Way of the Ascendant Dragon|Monk|THICC|Ascendant Dragon|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Way of the Cobalt Soul|Monk|THICC|Cobalt Soul|THICC|3

subclassFeatures: Way of the Arcane Form|Monk|THICC|Arcane Form|THICC|3

subclass.name: Oath of the Open Sea
subclassFeatures: Oath of the Open Sea|Paladin|THICC|Open Sea|THICC|3

subclass.name: The Great Old One
subclassFeatures: The Great Old One|Warlock|THICC|Great Old One|THICC|1

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist
entries: An Alchemist is an expert at combining reagents to produce mystical effects. Alchemists use their creations to give life and to leech it away. Alchemy is the oldest of artificer traditions, and its versatility has long been valued during times of war and peace.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Alchemist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Experimental Elixir
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, for a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus, you can spend ten minutes in {@status concentration|phb|concentration} experimenting with ingredients to produce an experimental elixir in an empty flask. Roll on the Experimental Elixir table for the elixir's effect, which is triggered when someone drinks the elixir. As an action, a creature can drink the elixir or administer it to an {@condition Incapacitated|phb} creature.
Creating an {@i experimental elixir} requires you to have {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} on your person, and any elixir you create with this feature lasts until it is drunk.

You can create additional {@i experimental elixirs} by expending a spell slot of 1st level or higher for each one. When you do so, you use your action to create the elixir in an empty flask you touch, and you choose the elixir's effect from the Experimental Elixir table.

entries.caption: Experimental Elixir
rows: {@b Healing}. The drinker regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your Intelligence modifier.
{@b Swiftness}. The drinker's walking speed increases by 10 feet for 1 hour.
{@b Resilience}. The drinker gains a +1 bonus to AC for 10 minutes.
{@b Boldness}. The drinker can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to every attack roll and saving throw they make for the next minute.
{@b Flight}. The drinker gains a flying speed equal to their walking speed for 1 minute.

{@b Transformation}. The drinker's body is transformed as if by the {@spell alter self|COOMS} spell. The drinker determines the transformation caused by the spell, the effects of which last for 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Savant
entries: At 5th level, you develop masterful command of magical chemicals, enhancing the healing and damage you create through them. Whenever you cast a spell using your {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} as the spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell. That roll must restore hit points or be a damage roll that deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage, and the bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Restorative Reagents
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can incorporate restorative reagents into some of your works:

items: Whenever a creature drinks an {@i experimental elixir} you created, the creature gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point).

You can cast {@spell lesser restoration} without expending a spell slot and without preparing the spell, provided you use {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} as the spellcasting focus. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Chemical Mastery
entries: By 15th level, you have been exposed to so many chemicals that they pose little risk to you, and you can use them to quickly end certain ailments:

items: You gain resistance to acid damage and poison damage, and you are immune to the {@condition Poisoned|phb} condition.

You can cast {@spell greater restoration} and {@spell heal} without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without material components, provided you use {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} as the spellcasting focus. Once you cast either spell with this feature, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Armorer
entries: An artificer who specializes as an Armorer modifies armor to function almost like a second skin. The armor is enhanced to hone the artificer's magic, unleash potent attacks, and generate a formidable defense. The artificer bonds with this armor, becoming one with it even as they experiment with it and refine its magical capabilities.

subclassFeature.name: Dampening Field
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on such checks, the advantage and disadvantage cancel each other, as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Field
entries: As a bonus action, you can gain temporary hit points equal to your level in this class, replacing any temporary hit points you already have. You lose these temporary hit points if you doff the armor. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Lightning Launcher
entries: A gemlike node appears on one of your armored fists or on the chest (your choice). It counts as a simple ranged weapon, with a normal range of 90 feet and a long range of 300 feet, and it deals {@damage 1d6} lightning damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with it, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage to that target.

subclassFeature.name: Powered Steps
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Thunder Gauntlets
entries: Each of the armor's gauntlets counts as a simple melee weapon while you aren't holding anything in it, and it deals {@damage 1d8} thunder damage on a hit. A creature hit by the gauntlet has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn, as the armor magically emits a distracting pulse when the creature attacks someone else.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Armor
entries: {@i 3rd-level Armorer feature}

Your metallurgical pursuits have led to you making armor a conduit for your magic. After spending an hour working as if in {@status concentration|phb|concentration}, you can turn a suit of armor you are wearing into Arcane Armor, provided you have {@item smith's tools|PHB} in hand.
You gain the following benefits while wearing this armor:

items: If the armor normally has a Strength requirement, the arcane armor lacks this requirement for you.
You can use the arcane armor as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells.

The armor attaches to you and can't be removed against your will. It also expands to cover your entire body, although you can retract or deploy the helmet as a bonus action. The armor replaces any missing limbs, functioning identically to a limb it replaces.
You can doff or don the armor as an action. The armor continues to be Arcane Armor until you don another suit of armor or you die.

subclassFeature.name: Armor Model
entries: {@i 3rd-level Armorer feature}
You can customize your Arcane Armor. When you do so, choose one of the following armor models: Guardian or Infiltrator. The model you choose gives you special benefits while you wear it.
Each model includes a special weapon. When you attack with that weapon, you can add your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, to the attack and damage rolls.
You can change the armor's model after spending an hour working as if in {@status concentration|phb|concentration}, provided you have {@item smith's tools|PHB} in hand.

entries.name: Guardian
entries: You design your armor to be in the front line of conflict. It has the following features:

entries.name: Infiltrator
entries: You customize your armor for subtle undertakings. It has the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Armorer Spells
entries: {@i 3rd-level Armorer feature}

You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Armorer Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: {@i 3rd-level Armorer feature}

You gain proficiency with heavy armor. You also gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|PHB}. If you already have this tool proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 5th-level Armorer feature}
You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Armor Modifications
entries: {@i 9th-level Armorer feature}

You learn how to use your artificer infusions to specially modify your Arcane Armor. That armor now counts as separate items for the purposes of your Infuse Items feature: armor (the chest piece), boots, helmet, and the armor's special weapon. Each of those items can bear one of your infusions, and the infusions transfer over if you change your armor's model with the Armor Model feature. In addition, the maximum number of items you can infuse at once increases by 2, but those extra items must be part of your Arcane Armor.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Armor
entries: {@i 15th-level Armorer feature}
Your Arcane Armor gains additional benefits based on its model, as shown below.

entries.name: Guardian
entries: When a Huge or smaller creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to magically force it to make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, you pull the creature up to 25 feet directly to an unoccupied space. If you pull the target to a space within 5 feet of you, you can make a melee weapon attack against it as part of this reaction.
You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Infiltrator
entries: Any creature that takes lightning damage from your Lightning Launcher glimmers with magical light until the start of your next turn. The glimmering creature sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls against you, as the light jolts it if it attacks you. In addition, the next attack roll against it has advantage, and if that attack hits, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Artillerist
entries: An Artillerist specializes in using magic to hurl energy, projectiles, and explosions on a battlefield. This destructive power was valued by all the armies of the Last War. Now that the war is over, some members of this specialization have sought to build a more peaceful world by using their powers to fight the resurgence of strife in Khorvaire.

The gnome artificer Vi, an unlikely yet key member of House Cannith's warforged project, has been especially vocal about making things right: "It's about time we fixed things instead of blowing them all to hell."

subclassFeature.name: Artillerist Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Artillerist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Artillerist Spells
rows: {@spell cone of cold}, {@spell wall of force|COOMS}

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Cannon
entries: At 3rd level, you learn how to create a magical cannon. Using {@item woodcarver's tools|PHB} or {@item smith's tools|PHB}, you can spend an hour working as if in {@status concentration|phb|concentration} to magically create a Small or Tiny eldritch cannon in an unoccupied space on a horizontal surface within 5 feet of you. A Small eldritch cannon occupies its space, and a Tiny one can be held in one hand.

Once you create a cannon, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or until you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. You can have only one cannon at a time and can't create one while your cannon is present.

The cannon is a magical object. Regardless of size, the cannon has an AC of 18 and a number of hit points equal to five times your artificer level. It is immune to poison damage and psychic damage, and all conditions. If it is forced to make an ability check or a saving throw, treat all its ability scores as 10 (+0). If the {@spell mending} spell is cast on it, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. It disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points or after 1 hour. You can dismiss it early as an action.

When you create the cannon, you determine its appearance and whether it has legs. You also decide which type it is, choosing from the options on the Eldritch Cannons table. On each of your turns, you can take a bonus action to cause the cannon to activate if you are within 60 feet of it. As part of the same bonus action, you can direct the cannon to walk or climb up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space, provided it has legs.

entries.caption: Eldritch Cannons
rows: The cannon exhales fire in an adjacent 15-foot cone that you designate. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 2d8} fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Make a ranged spell attack, originating from the cannon, at one creature or object within 120 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is pushed up to 5 feet away from the cannon.

The cannon emits a burst of positive energy that grants itself and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of it a number of temporary hit points equal to {@damage 1d8} + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item woodcarver's tools|PHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Firearm
entries: At 5th level, you know how to turn a wand, staff, or rod into an arcane firearm, a conduit for your destructive spells. When you finish a long rest, you can use {@item woodcarver's tools|PHB} to carve special sigils into a wand, staff, or rod and thereby turn it into your arcane firearm. The sigils disappear from the object if you later carve them on a different item. The sigils otherwise last indefinitely.

You can use your arcane firearm as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells. When you cast an artificer spell through the firearm, roll a {@damage d8}, and you gain a bonus to one of the spell's damage rolls equal to the number rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Explosive Cannon
entries: Starting at 9th level, every eldritch cannon you create is more destructive:

items: The cannon's damage rolls all increase by {@damage 1d8}.

As an action, you can command the cannon to detonate if you are within 60 feet of it. Doing so destroys the cannon and forces each creature within 20 feet of it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 3d8} force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Fortified Position
entries: Starting at 15th level, you're a master at forming well-defended emplacements using Eldritch Cannon:

items: You and your allies have half cover while within 10 feet of a cannon you create with Eldritch Cannon, as a result of a shimmering field of magical protection that the cannon emits.

You can now have two cannons at the same time. You can create two with the same action (but not the same spell slot), and you can activate both of them with the same bonus action. You determine whether the cannons are identical to each other or different. You can't create a third cannon while you have two.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Smith
entries: Armies require protection, and someone has to put things back together if defenses fail. A combination of protector and medic, a Battle Smith is an expert at defending others and repairing both material and personnel. To aid in their work, Battle Smiths are usually accompanied by a steel defender, a protective companion of their own creation. Many soldiers tell stories of nearly dying before being saved by a Battle Smith and a steel defender.

Battle Smiths played a key role in House Cannith's work on battle constructs and the original warforged, and after the Last War, these artificers led efforts to aid those who were injured in the war's horrific battles.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Ready
entries: When you reach 3rd level, your combat training and your experiments with magic have paid off in two ways:

items: You gain proficiency with martial weapons.
When you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Smith Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Battle Smith Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Steel Defender
entries: By 3rd level, your tinkering has borne you the blueprints for a faithful companion, a {@creature steel defender|tce}. It is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the steel defender {@creature steel defender|tce|stat block}, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. You determine the creature's appearance and whether it has two legs or four; your choice has no effect on its game statistics.

After spending 8 hours working as if in {@status concentration|phb|concentration}, you can create a new steel defender if you have your {@item smith's tools|PHB} with you. If you already have a steel defender from this feature, the first one immediately perishes. The defender also perishes if you die.

In combat, the defender shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its {@creature steel defender|tce|stat block} or some other action. If you are {@condition Incapacitated|phb}, the defender can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge}.

You may cast your artificer spells through your steel defender, which acts as an artificer focus for you. When you take the Cast a Spell action on your turn, you may designate that spell be cast from the steel defender's space, instead of your own. When you take this action, the spell will be cast during the steel defender's turn, using your action. If you did not use a bonus action during your turn to designate any other action for it to take, it will use its action to dodge.

If it has died, you can use your {@item smith's tools|PHB}, working as if in {@status concentration|phb|concentration}, the steel defender returns to life after 1 hour with all its hit points restored.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|PHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Jolt
entries: At 9th level, you learn new ways to channel arcane energy to harm or heal. When either you hit a target with a magic weapon attack or your steel defender hits a target, you can channel magical energy through the strike to create one of the following effects:

items: The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage.
Choose one creature or object you can see within 30 feet of the target. Healing energy flows into the chosen recipient, restoring {@dice 2d6} hit points to it.

entries: You can use this energy a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), but you can do so no more than once on a turn. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Defender
entries: At 15th level, your Arcane Jolt and steel defender become more powerful:

items: The extra damage and the healing of your Arcane Jolt both increase to {@damage 4d6}.
Your steel defender gains a +2 bonus to Armor Class.
Whenever your steel defender uses its Deflect Attack, the attacker takes force damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Demolitionist
entries: Demolitionists are an important part of any emerging contemporary civilization, both positively and negatively. Demolitionists use their knowledge of explosives to destroy unwanted structures, whether that be an old building, your enemy's walls, or even group formations.

subclassFeature.name: Demolitionist Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Demolitionist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiencies
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} and {@item smith's tools|PHB}. If you already have one or both these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one or two other types of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice respectively.

subclassFeature.name: Volatile Launcher
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to craft a volatile launcher with smith's tools. Over the course of an hour, as if concentrating, you can create your volatile launcher. If you attempt to create another while a volatile of yours created with this feature still exists, it will break soon after a new one is created.

Your volatile launcher is a handheld device or mechanism capable of igniting as well as flinging or shooting explosives to where they need to go. As a part of using a bomb, your volatile launcher can send the bomb out to 120 ft exactly where you need it to be for precise detonations. Your volatile launcher acts as a spellcasting focus for you to cast your Artificer spells through.

Your volatile launcher also builds up some of the raw energy of the explosives you shoot from it, requiring you to occasionally eject this energy. You can use an action to direct and expel this excess energy to a point within 120 ft of yourself a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus. When you do so, a random effect happens at the point chosen from the Explosive Expulsion table below. All damage done by an Explosive Expulsion is considered magical. You can choose to expend a 1st level spell slot to roll the effect before choosing a point within range.

You can also choose to expend a 2nd level or greater spell slot to create one of the effects from the table below. When you do so, you roll the effect before choosing the point you fire at. Expending a spell slot of 2nd level or higher heightens the effectiveness of the chosen ability, as disclosed in their effect description.

items: A massive heap of scrap is shot out from the launcher. Everyone in a 5-foot radius from the chosen point must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage, with half damage on a successful save. Objects take twice as much damage from this expulsion. Additionally, the area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, with each 5-foot-diameter portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

A congealed glob of shrapnel that detonates on impact is fired out from the launcher. Everyone in a 20-foot radius from the chosen point must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d4} piercing damage, or half as much on a success.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 3d4} for each slot level above 1st.

A massive cloud of toxic gas is vented from the launcher. A 30-foot radius cloud of opaque gas occupies the space around the chosen point. Any creature that starts its turn within the cloud must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} poison damage, or half as much on a success. The gas does not prevent creatures within it from breathing, but the damage can be circumvented with held breath. The cloud lasts for 10 minutes before dispersing, but it can be dispersed early by winds of 10 mph or greater.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the duration of the cloud increases by 10 minutes for each slot level above 1st.

A glowing piece of ember is shot from the launcher that explodes into a blinding light once it reaches its destination. Every creature within a 7.5-foot radius of the chosen point must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} radiant damage and become {@condition blinded|phb} until the end of their next turn, with half as much damage on a success.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

A ball of warbling cold energy is shot from the launcher. Every creature within a 15-foot radius of the chosen point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} cold damage and become {@condition Restrained|phb} for one minute as binding frost momentarily forms on them, with half as much on a successful save. A frozen creature can make a Strength saving throw at the end of their turns, breaking out of the ice on a success.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

A messy splash of burning oil is fired from the launcher, coating the ground in a 25-foot area around the chosen point. A creature who starts their turn in the burning oil must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} fire damage, with half as much on a successful save. The oil burns for 1 minute or until extinguished.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

A snot-like clod of acidic material is shot from your launcher. Every creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they are coated in acid. A creature coated in acid takes {@damage 1d4} acid damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use their action to remake the Dexterity saving throw to potentially wipe the acid off themselves, otherwise the acid dissipates after 1 minute.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

A forgotten bomb is fired from the launcher. Everyone within a 40-foot area must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d10} thunder damage, with half as much damage on a successful saving throw. Additionally, every creature within the area must also make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Deafened|phb} by the blast for 1 hour or until they receive any magical healing.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

subclassFeature.name: Destructive Force
entries: At 5th level, you learn how best to bring objects to ruin, allowing you to deal double damage to objects.

Additionally, whenever you cast a spell or fire an explosive out of your Volatile Launcher that deals damage in an area of effect and touches the ground, you can choose to have the ground beneath the area of the effect become {@quickref difficult terrain||3} until it is cleared, requiring 1 minute of work for each 5-foot segment. Spells that already cause this effect require 2 minutes instead. You can use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Chain Reaction
entries: At 9th level, you are at your best when you are at your most destructive. Whenever you cast a spell or fire an explosive out of your Volatile Launcher that deals damage in an area of effect, you can deal additional damage to the creatures that failed their save against the effect equal to the number of said failed creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Cluster Bombs
entries: At 15th level, you have perfected the art of explosives craft, as your bombs can make more bombs. Once per long rest, when you fire an Explosive Expulsion from your Volatile Launcher, you can specify that it is clustered. When you do so, you can create 4 instances of the given effect within 15 feet of the selected point at points you choose, with no two of the effects being at the same point.

subclassFeature.name: Toxicologist
entries: Toxicologists utilize their knowledge of various oils and poisons to coat their attacks in deadly concoctions that guarantee their victory, even if sometimes not immediately. The more power they can pack into their punch, the better.

subclassFeature.name: Toxicologist Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Toxicologist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Toxicologist Spells
rows: {@spell ray of enfeeblement|COOMS}, {@spell touch of idiocy|COOMS}

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item poisoner's kit|PHB}. If you already have one or both these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Virulent Dregs
entries: By the time you pick this subclass at 3rd level, the variety of weaponry you may use to deliver your poisons increases. You gain proficiency with martial weapons. In addition, your blades have gotten quite sullied with a myriad of toxins that they are able to infect or thin the blood of any creature they cut. As a result, you learn the {@spell Bloodletting|COOMS} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Toxic Coatings
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you realize that augmenting your attacks by pouring dangerous materials onto your weapon is an effective way to fight, augmenting your attacks with a Toxic Coating. Toxic Coatings are poisons, oils, or any other sort of coating that is doused over your weapon to make it more fiersome.

You can spend ten minutes in {@status concentration|phb|concentration} fiddling around with dangerous chemicals to produce a random Toxic Coating in an empty vial from the Toxic Coating table below. You can do this a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus.

As an action, Toxic Coatings can be applied to a weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition, and evaporate after a minute. When a creature is struck by the coated object, the creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw or suffer the effects as detailed by the coating. If the coating is ingested, the creature makes this save at disadvantage.

You can create additional Toxic Coatings by expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can choose which coating you produce. Depending on the spell slot expended, the coating increases in potency, as detailed per coating.

items: A creature poisoned by this coating is {@condition Charmed|phb} by all creatures around it, and is in a good mood. The creature will avoid conflict and opt to not fight unless it is currently being attacked. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 hour, remaking their save whenever they take damage and at the end of every turn in combat or at the end of every minute out of combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 1st.

A creature poisoned by this coating is {@condition Frightened|phb} by all creatures around it, and is paranoid of those around them. The creature will avoid conflict and opt to find somewhere to take a breather or flee unless it is currently being attacked. The creature is poisoned in this way for 10 minutes, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat or at the end of every minute out of combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the duration increases by 10 minutes for each slot level above 1st.

A creature poisoned by this coating is {@condition Stunned|phb}, experiencing vivid bright hallucinations. The creature may come out of the experience wanting to be poisoned in this way again. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 minute, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the duration increases by 1 minute for each slot level above 1st.
A creature poisoned by this coating takes an additional {@damage 2d4} poison damage. The creature is poisoned in this way for 10 minutes, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

A creature poisoned by this coating takes an additional {@damage 1d6} acid damage. If any of the damage die rolled is the maximum value, a piece of that creature's equipment suffers a -1 penalty as the mixture of acid and blood pours onto their equipment, potentially breaking it. Creatures poisoned with this coating are only poisoned until the end of your turn.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

A creature poisoned by this coating takes an additional {@damage 1d6} lightning damage. If the creature is struck again with a weapon attack before this poison is over, the creature takes another {@damage 1d6} lightning damage and the poison ends. Creatures poisoned with this coating are poisoned until the end of your next turn if the effect does not end early.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

A creature poisoned by this coating takes an additional {@dice 1d4x4} thunder damage. This coating is extremely volatile, and for every die that explodes, a miniature bang blows open the creature's wound. Creatures poisoned with this coating are only poisoned until the end of your turn.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.
A weapon coated in this becomes +1 magical until the coating evaporates, if it was not already magical.

A creature poisoned by this coating takes an additional {@damage 1d4} force damage. The wounds created by damage inflicted with this coating momentarily emanate a blue haze. Creatures poisoned with this coating are only poisoned until the end of your turn.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

A creature poisoned by this coating takes an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage. The wound created by the radiant damage glows a faint hue. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 minute, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat and retaking the damage on every failed save.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage increases by {@damage 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

A creature poisoned by this coating takes an additional {@damage 1d4} fire damage. While poisoned in this way, their wound cauterizes itself, making them take 1d4 less healing from all sources. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 minute, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage and healing reduction increase by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

A creature poisoned by this coating takes an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage. While poisoned in this way, their wound body moves stiffly as if frozen, and their speed is halved. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 minute, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage and healing reduction increase by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

A creature poisoned by this coating takes an additional {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage. Their blood soaks into the dark coating, and from it you heal the amount of necrotic damage dealt. Creatures poisoned with this coating are only poisoned until the end of your turn.
When you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher using this feature, the damage and healing reduction increase by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Hazardous Coatings
entries: At 9th level, applying a coating to a weapon is second nature to you now. Whenever you apply a poison or oil to a weapon that takes an action to apply, you may now apply that to a weapon by substituting one of your attacks to do so, provided you take the {@action Attack} action that turn. If the poison or oil takes a minute to apply, it now only takes an action for you.
Additionally, your development of experimental poisons has developed to allow you to refine your gathering of malignant materials into powerful toxins that can readily disable your opponents.

You can spend ten minutes in {@status concentration|phb|concentration} mixing your now-familiar assortment of deadly concoctions to produce a random Hazardous Coating in an empty well from the Hazardous Coating table below. You can do this once per long rest.

As an action, Hazardous Coatings can be applied to a weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition, and evaporate after a minute. When a creature is struck by the coated object, the creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw or suffer the effects as detailed by the coating. If the coating is ingested, the creature makes this save at disadvantage.

You can create additional Hazardous Coatings by expending a spell slot of 3rd level or greater. When you do so, you can choose which coating you produce. Depending on the spell slot expended, the coating increases in potency, as detailed per coating.

items: A creature poisoned by this coating is put to an unfightable state of drowsiness, causing the creature to fall asleep. The creature remains asleep for 8 hours or until awoken by taking damage or by a creature using its action to wake the creature. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 hour, remaking their save at the end of every minute. When a creature fails this save, they fall back asleep if they are awake.
When you expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher using this feature, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 3rd.

A creature poisoned by this coating is struck with an unsurpassable stillness, and becomes {@condition Paralyzed|phb}. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 minute, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher using this feature, the duration increases by 1 minute for each slot level above 3rd.

A creature poisoned by this coating is {@condition Deafened|phb}. The creature is poisoned in this way for 10 minutes, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat or at the end of every minute out of combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher using this feature, the duration increases by 10 minutes for each slot level above 3rd.
A creature poisoned by this coating is {@condition blinded|phb}. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 minute, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher using this feature, the duration increases by 1 minute for each slot level above 3rd.

A creature poisoned by this coating is put into a state of animalistic fury, becoming {@condition frenzied}. The creature will attack any creature close to it at random as dictated by the DM. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 minute, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher using this feature, the duration increases by 1 minute for each slot level above 3rd.
When you acquire this coating, choose a damage type.

A creature poisoned by this coating is made vulnerable to the chosen damage type, provided it is not immune to the chosen damage type. The creature is poisoned in this way for 1 minute, remaking their save at the end of every turn in combat.
When you expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher using this feature, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 3rd.

subclassFeature.name: Potency
entries: At 15th level, you discover ways to make your poisons affect any creature, even the extrasensory or supernatural. Enemies cannot be immune to poisons or the {@condition Poisoned|phb} condition from spells you cast or from coatings, poisons, or oils you create. Instead, their immunity is treated as resistance or advantage against saving throws that would make them {@condition Poisoned|phb} respectively.

subclassFeature.name: Gonner
entries: Gonners are a fighter that uses their access to the gnomish art of firearm smithing to their advantage, and believe that the future of fighting relies on the developments of gnomes. As such, they tend to be weapon enthusiasts with an excitement for machines of war.

subclassFeature.name: Gonner Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Gonner Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|PHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Gonne Nut
entries: Due to the familiarity with weapons you must possess to be able to design one as powerful as a firearm, you have proficiency with Martial Weapons and have advantage on any checks made to determine the origin or history of a given piece of equipment.

subclassFeature.name: Gonnesmithing
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to craft a gonne with {@item smith's tools|PHB}. Over the course of an hour, as if in {@status concentration|phb|concentration}, you can create a usable gonne. If you attempt to create another while a gonne of yours created with this feature still exists, it will break soon after a new one is created.

In addition, you learn special ways of customizing the technology of war like a true gnome. You gain access to additional Infusions you can know, as found {@filter here|optionalfeatures|feature type=gi|source=THICC}. You must replace at least one of your infusions with one of the gonner infusions from there, though you can replace more of your infusions with the ones found there if you wish.
When you infuse a firearm or crossbow with a gonner infusion, the weapon becomes a spellcasting focus for you to cast your Artificer spells through.

subclassFeature.name: Gonner Specialty
entries: At 3rd level, you have a specialty that assists your gonneplay in combat. Choose one of the following features:
{@b Attachment Mastery:} You are able to place an additional infusion onto an already-infused crossbow or firearm, provided that the additional infusion is one of your gonner infusions.
{@b Hustle & Dive:} You can Dash or Disengage as a bonus action.
{@b One-Minute Breather:} You may spend a minute in respite to recover HP equal to 1d8 + your Artificer level once per short rest.
{@b Smart Shots:} You can use your Intelligence modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity when fighting with magic weapons.

{@b Quick Draw:} By quickly pulling, firing, and stowing your weapon of choice, you are able to substitute an attack when you take the attack action to fire a pistol or hand crossbow that is not equipped. You can also use this feature to throw a weapon with the thrown property that is not equipped. You must have the ability to equip the weapon in order to use this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Gonner Expertise
entries: Continuing at 9th level, you further specialize in a feature that assists your presence in combat. Choose one of the following features:
{@b Juggernaut:} You gain an additional 2 hit points for every level in artificer.
{@b Deft Hands:} You can reload a firearm with an action a number of times per short rest equal to your proficiency bonus.
{@b Matchlock Mastery:} You can now craft an Arquebus or Hand Cannon using your Gonnesmithing feature, and can have an additional firearm active at any given time.

{@b Held Breath:} If you haven't moved this turn, you can choose to make your movement 0 ft for this round to make your next ranged weapon or spell attack roll at advantage. Additionally, you have trained your lungs to hold your breath for longer than the average person. You may hold your breath for a number of minutes equal to your Constitution score.

{@b Bomber:} You are able to launch volatile explosives from your firearm of choice. You may cast the fireball spell using your Artificer spellcasting focus a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Gonner Mastery
entries: Finally, at 15th level, you gain a capstone feature that presents itself as the cornerstone of your gonneplay. Choose one of the following features:
{@b Flintlock Mastery:} You can now craft a Pistol, Musket, or Blunderbuss using your Gonnesmithing feature, and can have an additional two firearms active at any given time.

{@b Grit:} When you are reduced to 0 hp by an attack but not outright killed, you may use your reaction to attempt to grit your teeth through the pain and fight through it. Make a Constitution saving throw whose DC is equal to 40 minus your Artificer level. On a success, you are set at 1 HP and regain TempHP equal to half your current Max Health.

{@b Martyrdom:} Your knowledge in the art of war has led you to the conclusion that your death shall never be in vain. Once per long rest, when you are knocked unconscious in combat, you cast the discharge and detonate spells. This feature can be toggled ready and unready with an action, but it can only happen once per long rest.
{@b Sniper:} Your range is tripled for all firearms and any spells cast through your spellcasting focus.
{@b Swagger Stance:} You are able to hold and fire any firearm or crossbow with one hand.

subclassFeature.name: Giant Power
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Path of the Giant Feature}

When you choose this path, you learn to speak, read, and write Giant or one other language of your choice if you already know Giant. Additionally, you learn a cantrip of your choice: either {@spell druidcraft} or {@spell thaumaturgy}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

subclassFeature.name: Giant's Havoc
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Path of the Giant Feature}
Your rages pull strength from the primal might of giants, transforming you into a hulking force of destruction. While raging, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Crushing Throw
items.entry: When you make a successful ranged attack with a thrown weapon using Strength, you can add your Rage Damage bonus to the attack's damage roll.

items.name: Giant Stature
entries: When you rage, you magically increase in size. If you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If there isn't enough room for you to increase your size, your size doesn't change. If your size is Large or larger when you are enraged, you gain the following additional benefits:

items: Your current hit points and your hit point maximum both increase by 1 per barbarian level.
Your walking speed increaes by 5 feet.
Your reach increases by 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Giant
entries: Barbarians who walk the Path of the Giant draw strength from the same primal forces as giants. As they rage, these barbarians surge with elemental power and grow in size, taking on forms that evoke the glory of giants. Some barbarians look like oversized versions of themselves, perhaps with a hint of elemental energy flaring in their eyes and around their weapons. Others transform more dramatically, taking on the appearance of an actual giant or a form similar to an Elemental, wreathed in fire, frost, or lightning.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Cleaver
entries: {@i 6th-Level Path of the Giant Feature}
Your bond with the elemental might of giants grows, and you learn to infuse weapons with primordial energy.

When you enter your rage, you can choose one weapon that you are holding and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, thunder, or lightning. While you wield the infused weapon during your rage, the weapon's damage type changes to the chosen type, it deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of the chosen type when it hits, and it gains the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If you throw the weapon, it reappears in your hand the instant after it hits or misses a target. The infused weapon's benefits are suppressed while a creature other than you wields it.
While raging and holding the infused weapon, you can use a bonus action to change the infused weapon's current damage type to another one from the damage type options above.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Impel
entries: {@i 10th-Level Path of the Giant Feature}

Your connection to giant strength allows you to hurl both allies and enemies on the battlefield. As a bonus action while raging, you can choose one Medium or smaller creature within your reach and move it to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of yourself. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) to avoid the effect.
If, at the end of this movement, the thrown creature isn't on a surface or liquid that can support it, the creature falls, taking damage as normal and landing {@condition Prone|phb}.

subclassFeature.name: Demiurgic Colossus
entries: {@i 14th-Level Path of the Giant Feature}

The primordial power of your rage intensifies. When you rage, you can choose to have your size increase even further. If you are smaller than Huge, you become Huge, along with anything you are wearing. If there isn't enough room for you to increase your size, your size doesn't change. If your size is Huge or larger when you are enraged, you gain the benefits of being Large while enraged, as well as the following additional benefits:

items: Your current hit points and your hit point maximum both increase by 1 per barbarian level.
Your walking speed increaes by an additional 5 feet.
Your reach increases by an additional 5 feet.
You can use your Mighty Impel to move creatures that are Large or smaller.

entries: In addition, the extra damage dealt by your Elemental Cleaver feature increases to {@dice 2d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Berserker
entries: For some barbarians, rage is a means to an end—that end being violence. The Path of the Berserker is a path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the berserker's rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzy
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, you can go into a frenzy when you rage. If you do so, for the duration of your rage you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns after this one. When your rage ends, you must pass a DC 15 Constitution save or suffer one level of {@condition Exhaustion|phb}.

subclassFeature.name: Mindless Rage
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can't be {@condition Charmed|phb} or {@condition Frightened|phb} while raging. If you are {@condition Charmed|phb} or {@condition Frightened|phb} when you enter your rage, the effect is suspended for the duration of the rage.

subclassFeature.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can use your action to frighten someone with your menacing presence. When you do so, choose one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or be {@condition Frightened|phb} of you until the end of your next turn. On subsequent turns, you can use your action to extend the duration of this effect on the {@condition Frightened|phb} creature until the end of your next turn. This effect ends if the creature ends its turn out of line of sight or more than 60 feet away from you.
If the creature succeeds on its saving throw, you can't use this feature on that creature again for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Retaliation
